content.rendered: The Developer Students Club (DSC) of our University which is powered by Google Developers, held seminars in the first as well as the second session of the current semester. The first seminar, ‘Introduction to Android Development’ was held on 6th July ’19. Students were taught the basics of Android App Development followed by a workshop where students gained hands-on experience. The seminar was well received by the students and introduced them to the world of app development which is a trending field in smartphone technology. The Cloud Study Jam seminar was conducted on 13th July and was focused on the Google Cloud Platform and its fundamentals. They were taught the basics of Cloud Computing and later during the workshop, they were given access to Google Cloud Platform itself to perform various tasks in the form of labs. Their progress was tracked and on successful completion of the labs, they were provided with goodies from Google Developers. Due to the enthusiasm shown by the students and limited seats, the club conducted a second Cloud Study Jam on 10th Aug for the students who could not attend the first. The seminar ‘Machine Learning from Scratch’, was conducted on 19th July where the students were introduced to the fascinating world of machine learning. They learned about various libraries and gained hands-on experience in neural networks later in the workshop. All the seminars were received with great enthusiasm from the students. They were coordinated by the Developer Students Club Lead Vivek Parmar ( CE 7th Semester) and the members from the respective teams of Android Development, Google Cloud Platform and Machine Learning. The seminars were a great success and the efforts of Developer Student Club to introduce students to the latest as well as trending technologies were commendable.

The first seminar, ‘Introduction to Android Development’ was held on 6th July ’19. Students were taught the basics of Android App Development followed by a workshop […]

content.rendered: On 14th December 2019, a seminar on oral implantology was conducted by Faculty of Dental Science. Dr Arvind U D, an Oral and Maxillofacial surgeon, gave a guest lecture on Implantology and Maxillofacial surgery. He was awarded “Excellence in Dental Implantology” by Indian Health Professional awards, New Delhi in 2017. He has an experience of over ten years in the field of Dental Implantology. He is the CEO of Dr Arvind’s Dental and Maxillofacial clinic in Hyderabad. In this seminar, he explained the research carried out on Implantology and Maxillofacial surgery and its advantages in detail. Implantology is a branch of dentistry dedicated to dental implants of an artificial tooth. Oral and maxillofacial surgery is focused on treating problems related to the hard and soft tissues of the face, mouth and jaws. He focused on the technique to perform the surgery and its success rate over a period. The lecture was then followed by a live demonstration of the surgery on an oral model. His expertise in the field and experience made the study of Implantology easy and very useful for the students of Dental Science. The seminar was very beneficial for the students.

content.rendered: The NSS-Spandan Student Body, an active participant of the Electoral Literacy Club from Dharmsinh Desai University had organized the Electoral Literacy Program on 12th December 2019 for awareness regarding registration of students eligible as voters. Mr V M Rajput, Dy District Election Officer, Kheda, had sensitized the students through a presentation for the online & offline voters’ registration process. He had announced that from 16th December 2019 the voters name registration and modification process would be starting and encouraged students to participate in the same and perform their national duty. The event was graced by the presence of Prof Anjali Thakur, NSS Coordinator; Prof R K Jain, Registrar, DDU; Dr Nimesh Joshi, Principal, DDIC, BBA; Mr G R Meriya, Principal, DDIC, Commerce College (Guj. Med.); Dr. Khan, Principal, DDIC, Commerce College (Eng. Med.); Mr Umang Patel, Dy Collector & Prant Officer, Mahudha; Mr Prakash Khristi, Mamlatdar, Nadiad; Ms Manishaben Soni, Mamlatdar, Election and Ms Kajalben Dave, District Education Officer. Sharing the vision of strengthening the world’s largest democracy, Shri I K Patel, Collector & District Election Officer, Kheda, had echoed the message of “No voter to be left behind” amongst the masses. The students gave their valuable feedback and perceived ideas about the overall program as a part of the Electoral Literacy Club-New Voters Campaign. The program ended on high notes of unity as everyone sang the National Anthem together.

Mr V M Rajput, Dy District Election Officer, Kheda, had sensitized the students through a presentation for the online & […]

content.rendered:
Prof Daniel Talham, Professor and Chair, Department of Chemistry, University of Florida was invited to Dharmsinh Desai University on 19th November, 2019.

Prof Talham interacted with the Research Scholars and Faculty Members of the Shah-Schulman Center for Surface Science & Nanotechnology (SSCSSN) and the Department of Chemical Engineering. He was apprised of the research activities carried out in the Center and Department which was highly appreciated by him. Prof Talham elaborated upon the system prevailing in University of Florida for research and getting fellowship for doctoral studies.

He visited the SSCSSN and was happy to see the state of art analytical facility and praised vision of Prof D O Shah, Founding Director.

title.rendered: Blood Donation Camp Organized By NSS

content.rendered:
It is truly said that “A single pint can save three lives; a single gesture can create a million smiles.” DDU has always contributed for a noble cause for the betterment of society by conducting various events at university.  The camp began at 10:00 AM in the morning and received a great positive response from the donors across different departments, all day long. A small inauguration ceremony was held which was presided by various dignitaries including Dr. H. M. Desai, Vice Chancellor, DDU; Prof. R. K. Jain, Registrar,DDU; Prof D. G. Panchal, Dean, FoT; Dr. Jatin G Buch, Dean of Dr. N. D. Desai Medical Science and Research, Prof Prof Anjali Thakur, Coordinator, NSS; NSS Program Officers Prof D. J. Vyas, Prof. Sandeep Suthar and Brijesh Waghela and heads of different departments.

The ceremony started with a prayer and lightening of the lamp by all the dignitaries. The dignitaries motivated and congratulated the donors for their courage and participation in such a noble cause. Prof R. K. Jain congratulated the students on conducting such a noble drive in the University and encouraged them to continue such events. Two wheelchairs were donated by FoT, DDU to Dr. N. D. Desai Medical Science and Research. Students and faculties from different departments participated with great enthusiasm. 104 people donated blood and 85 plus units of blood were collected. All the donors were given  refreshments and awarded with a certificate of appreciation and gift vouchers from the NSS unit. The event was a huge success and this wouldn’t have been possible without the hard work and determination of all the NSS members.

DDU Connect congratulates NSS for supporting the noble cause and wishes this drive turns to be helpful for many lives. We also convey heartfelt gratitude to all those who donated blood to save precious lives.

excerpt.rendered: It is truly said that “A single pint can save three lives; a single gesture can create a million smiles.” DDU has always contributed for a noble cause for the betterment of society by conducting various events at university.  The camp began at 10:00 AM in the morning and received a great positive response from […]

content.rendered:
“‘Bhagwa or the saffron colour denotes renunciation of disinterestedness. Our leaders must be indifferent to material gains and dedicate themselves to their work. The white in the centre is light, the path of truth to guide our conduct. The green shows our relation to son, our relation to the plant life here on which all other life depends. The Ashoka Wheel in the center of the white is the wheel of the law of dhanna, Truth or satya, dharma or virtue ought to be the controlling principles of those who work under this flag. Again, the wheel denotes motion, There is death in stagnation. There is life in movement. India should no more resist change, it must move and go forward. The wheel represents the dynamism of a peaceful change.”

                                                                                             -Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan                                                                                                            Former President of India

On 15th August, 2019, Dharmsinh Desai University celebrated the 73rd  Independence Day of India at the central lawn. The faculty and students of DDU and the D. P. Desai School, along with the volunteers from NSS-Spandan gathered for the flag hoisting ceremony. The national flag was hoisted by our Guest of Honour, Mr. Dinsha Patel, the former Member of Parliament for Kheda Constituency, in the presence of  Dr. H.M. Desai, Vice Chancellor, DDU; Prof. R. K. Jain, Registrar, DDU; Shri Ankur H. Desai, Campus Director, DDU; Deans of various faculties, HoDs and faculty members.

Our Guest of Honour, Mr. Dinsha Patel, addressed the gathering. In his speech, he dignified the national flag and described the sovereign, secular and progressive ethos of the tricolour. The address was followed by a vote of thanks, which marked the conclusion of the ceremony. With a promise to uphold the dignity of our constitution, the assembly was dispersed.

excerpt.rendered: “‘Bhagwa or the saffron colour denotes renunciation of disinterestedness. Our leaders must be indifferent to material gains and dedicate themselves to their work. The white in the centre is light, the path of truth to guide our conduct. The green shows our relation to son, our relation to the plant life here on which all […]

content.rendered: On 25th march 2019,the newly found “The Readers’ Community” had organised an introductory event for the students to introduce the community,it’s moto and the future plans of the community. The event had a code name in sanskrit, which is “Abhimantryate” means welcome. This signified that the readers are always welcomed to this community. Garima Singh welcomed all the students and explained the purpose and definition of community. The event began with a book talk by Hardik Prajapati on “Creativity Inc.” and explained how this community’s establishment can be related with the principles mentioned in the book. It explained the journey of Pixar, the great animation studio found by retired CEO,Edwin Catmull. Later on, the event was followed by the story of origin of this community. Dipesh Patil narrated very well the journey of the idea of community from small room discussions to a happening reality. Moving forward, Aasnil Shah explained the working of the community’s decentralised library and how one can play a significant role by contributing books to the library.He also explained how this community will help the beginners to inculcate this beneficial and necessary habit in their day to day life. The event was carried forward by another book talk on a “Metamorphosis”. At the end, the scenario of future was projected to the students. The community is looking forward to conduct book talks,seminars on self development, group discussions on current affairs, games to improve their vocabulary and build their communication skills and more importantly to let the river of knowledge flow to the farmlands of people. The end of the event was marked with vote of thanks.

excerpt.rendered: On 25th march 2019,the newly found “The Readers’ Community” had organised an introductory event for the students to introduce the community,it’s moto and the future plans of the community. title.rendered: OPENING CEREMONY OF SAMVAAD: VERBALIZING MINDS.​

content.rendered:
With  the advent of the very first communication club, ‘Samvaad, Verbalising Minds’, of the university, an inspiring session was held at the seminar hall, by Mr. Bhavin Shah. The event was held on 8th July 2019, at 5:30pm and was attended by 112 students. Samvaad aims to improve the communication skills of students by organizing speeches, debates, group discussions and much more. As its opening ceremony, a speech on importance of communication skills is the correct fit.

Mr. Bhavin Shah is a corporate mentor and life coach. He is also the founder and CEO of I.M.Possible training solutions, an international company that trains corporates in communication skills. The event was facilitated by honouring Mr. Shah with a token of appreciation for his commendable work and his passion for work. Mr. Shah commenced his speech by citing an example of the rich human potential. His inspirational speech largely focused on the importance of communication skills in the corporate industry as well as our personal life. He emphasized his motto in life, “My greatest pleasure in life is training you on what people say you cannot do.” At the end a small Q&A round took place between Mr. Shah and the students wherein the students asked him their doubts on social anxiety and other related topics.

The Samvaad community is strongly committed to its vision of self-development and with the dedication of the students, they are sure to reach the top. The event was culminated with a vote of thanks by the members of the club and the students.

The event was held on 8th July 2019, at 5:30pm and was attended by 112 students. Samvaad aims to improve the communication skills of students by organizing speeches, […]

content.rendered:
• March 13, 2019

On the 26th of January, the Republic of India not only celebrates the day our constitution came into effect, but also commemorates the contributions of the Fathers of our Constitution.

On the cold winter morning of 26th January, 2019, Dharmsinh Desai University celebrated the 70th Republic Day of India at the central lawn. The faculty and students of DDU and the D. P. Desai School, along with the volunteers from NSS-Spandan gathered for the flag hoisting ceremony. The national flag was hoisted by our Guest of Honour, Mr. Parthiv Vyas, the Chief Engineer of the Statue of Unity in the presence of  Dr. H.M. Desai, Vice Chancellor, DDU; Prof. R. K. Jain, Registrar, DDU; Shri Ankur H. Desai, Campus Director, DDU; Deans of various faculties, HoDs and faculty members.

Our Guest of Honour, Mr. Parthiv Vyas, addressed the gathering. He expressed immense pride for being an alumnus of DDU and appreciated Dr. H.M. Desai and all the faculty members for upholding the foundation of discipline since fifty years and promising to do the same for years ahead. The address was followed by a vote of thanks, which marked the conclusion of the ceremony. With a promise to uphold the dignity of our constitution, the assembly was dispersed.

excerpt.rendered: On the 26th of January, the Republic of India not only celebrates the day our constitution came into effect, but also commemorates the contributions of the Fathers of our Constitution. On the cold winter morning of 26th January, 2019, Dharmsinh Desai University celebrated the 70th Republic Day of India at the central lawn. The faculty and students of […]

content.rendered:
“Be the change you wish to see.”

-Mahatma Gandhi

Envisioning the enthusiasm for change and the desire for “New India”, Hon. P.M. Shri Narendra Modi had urged to organize the event of Youth Parliament in each district of states at various levels to perceive the ideas of the youth. Upholding the motto of “Upliftment of the Nation” and being selected as a nodal institute for Kheda district, Dharmsinh Desai University along with the NSS Student Body had organized the district level of “Youth Parliament” on 24th January,2019. Students from various colleges of Kheda district participated with great anticipation. Amongst the dignitaries were present Dr. H.M Desai, Vice-Chancellor, DDU; Mr. Pankaj Desai, MLA, Nadiad Constituency; Prof. R.K Jain, Registrar, DDU; Shri. Ankur Desai, Director, DDU and Prof. D.G Panchal, Dean, FoT, DDU to grace the event and motivate the participants. Participants had shared their views with great confidence on the following topics:

1) India sets global narratives on terrorism.

2) India sets global narratives on economic offenders.

3) India sets global narratives on climate change.

4) Khelo India: A gateway for budding sportspersons.

The competent jury consisted of Social Activist Ms. Nandita Thakur; Mr. Devusinh Chauhan, MP, Kheda District; Mr. Gautam Brahmbhatt, Social Media Activist and Mr. Mahesh Mehta, Social Media Activist. The knowledge of the jury had a great influence on the participants. Jacky Thakkar, Rohan Rajput, and Nirmalsinh Chauhan were applauded as they emerged as the district winners. These winners will now compete at the state level.
